Vietnam: Emperor Tự Đức (1847–1883) became ruler of Vietnam.
USA: The Kansas–Nebraska Act is passed, nullifying the Missouri Compromise.
The Convention of Kanagawa is signed.
Singapore: Convent of the Holy Infant Jesus (CHIJ) is established.
Russia: Crimean War: Britain and France declared war on Russia.
Crimean War: In order to prevent the Austrian Empire entering the war, Russia evacuated Wallachia and Moldavia.
Philippine: Manuel Pavía y Lacy appointed Governor-General (1854)
Ramón Montero y Blandino appointed Governor-General (1854)
Manuel Crespo y Cebrían appointed Governor-General (1854)
Japan: Ansei great earthquakes series starts by 1854 Tōkai earthquake and tsunami
Colombia: José María Melo is President of the Republic of New Granada
Brazil: The first railway in Brazil is inaugurated by Pedro II of Brazil on in Rio de Janeiro, built by the Viscount of Maua.
Argentina: Urquiza became first President of Argentina in modern sense but opposed by Buenos Aires, still opposed to federal project
